16

17

20

26

// ================================================================================================================================ //
31
32
/// A trait that represents an App/Game.
33
pub trait Game: Sync {
34
    /// The core game logic should be run.
35
    /// Return `false` or `panic` to stop the Game Loop.
36
    fn update(&mut self, engine: &mut EngineState) -> bool;
37
38
    /// The render logic should be run.
39
    /// Return `false` or `panic` to stop the Game Loop.
40
    fn render(&mut self, engine: &mut EngineState) -> bool;
41
}
42
43
// ================================================================================================================================ //
44
45
/// Runner for Game Loops.
46
pub struct GameEngine<'a> {
47
    /// Internal shared state, wrapped in a Reader-Writer Lock.
48
    state: RwLock<(&'a mut dyn Game, EngineState)>,
49
50
    /// Waitable VSYNC barrier, for synchronizing Update and Render threads.
51
    vsync_barrier: Barrier,
52
53
    /// Initial settings.
54
    init_settings: GameEngineSettings,
55
}
56
unsafe impl<'a> Sync for GameEngine<'a> {}
57
58
/// State wrapped by Game Engine.
59
pub struct EngineState {
60
    /// Vulkan Renderer.
61
    pub(crate) vk: Vulkan,
62
63
    /// The visible Window on the Desktop.
64
    pub(crate) wyn_window: Option<Window>,
65
66
    /// User-control for Window.
67
    pub window: WindowSettings,
68
69
    /// Settings for the Renderer.
70
    pub render: RenderSettings,
71
72
    /// Timer for scheduling Update-calls.
73
    pub timer: FrameTimer,
74
}
75
76

    fn window_close(&self, events: &EventLoop, handle: WindowHandle) {

//! # Rust Game Engine (RGE)
8
//!
9
//! A library that makes writing a game simple.
10
//!
11
//! Supports 2D Graphics, such as Sprites, Tilemaps, and Shapes.
12
13
// ================================================================================================================================ //
14
15
#![warn(rustdoc::missing_crate_level_docs)]
16
#![warn(rustdoc::bare_urls)]
17
#![warn(missing_docs)]
18
#![deny(clippy::missing_docs_in_private_items)]
19
20

21
22

23

25

27

77

    // -------------------------------- //

// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //

impl RenderSettings {
96
    /// Special Index value to indicate the end of a Strip/Fan.
97
    const SENTINEL_IDX: u16 = 0xFFFF;
98
99
    /// Clears the render settings to the default settings.
100
1.77k
    pub fn clear(&mut self) {
101
1.77k
        self.backcolor = glsl::vec4(0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 1.0);
102
1.77k
103
1.77k
        self.point_list.clear();
104

//! Timer that allows syncing to a particular Framerate by sleeping.

8

/// A waitable timer that syncs to a desired Frames-Per-Second.
18
pub struct FrameTimer {

    /// The Instant the Timer was started.

30

    /// Sleeps the current thread until the after the Next Frame has started.
195
2.75k
    pub(crate) fn sync(tick: Instant) {
196
2.75k
        let rem = tick.checked_duration_since(Instant::now());

198
2.75k
        if let Some(dur) = rem {

            std::thread::sleep(dur);
200
2.75k
        } else {

0
            std::thread::yield_now();
202
0
        }

    }

    pub(crate) fn sync(tick: Instant) {

/// Initializes any OS-related state for proper Timer functionality.
217
1
fn init_os_timer() {
218
1
    #[cfg(target_os = "windows")]
219
1
    {
220
1
        let mut caps = unsafe { core::mem::zeroed() };
221
1
        let caps_size = size_of::<sys::TIMECAPS>() as u32;
222
1
223
1
        let res = unsafe { sys::timeGetDevCaps(addr_of_mut!(caps), caps_size) };
224
1
        assert_eq!(res, sys::MMSYSERR_NOERROR);
225
226
1
        let res = unsafe { sys::timeBeginPeriod(caps.wPeriodMin) };
227
1
        assert_eq!(res, sys::TIMERR_NOERROR);
228
    }
229
1
}

/// Wrapper for a `VkInstance`.\
16
/// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkInstance.html>
17
pub struct Instance {
18
    /// Inner `ash` `VkInstance`.
19
    pub inner: ash::Instance,
20
21
    /// Layers supported by this Instance.
22
    pub layers: Layers,
23
24
    /// Extensions supported by this Instance.
25
    pub extensions: Extensions,
26
}
27
28
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
29
30
impl Instance {
31
    /// Queries the Supported Extensions/Layers and creates a Vulkan Instance.
32
1
    pub fn new(entry: &ash::Entry) -> Aliased<Self> {
33
1
        let extensions = Extensions::supported_instance(entry);
34
1
        let required_extensions = Extensions::required_instance();
35
1
        let unsupported_extensions: Vec<_> =
36
1
            extensions.unsupported(required_extensions.iter()).collect();
37
1
        assert!(unsupported_extensions.is_empty());
38
39
1
        let layers = Layers::supported_instance(entry);
40
1
        let required_layers = Layers::required_instance();
41
1
        let unsupported_layers: Vec<_> = layers.unsupported(required_layers.iter()).collect();
42
1
        assert!(unsupported_layers.is_empty());
43
44
1
        let app_info = vk::ApplicationInfo {
45
1
            api_version: vk::make_api_version(0, 1, 0, 0),
46
1
            ..Default::default()
47
1
        };
48
1
49
1

50
1
            p_application_info: &app_info,
51
1

52
1
            enabled_extension_count: required_extensions.len() as u32,
53
1
            pp_enabled_layer_names: required_layers.as_ptr() as *const *const c_char,
54
1
            enabled_layer_count: required_layers.len() as u32,
55
1
            ..Default::default()
56
1
        };
57
1

58
1
59
1

60
1
            inner,
61
1
            extensions,
62
1
            layers,
63
1
        };

//! Internal utilities for loading and using Instance Extension functions.
7
8
// ================================================================================================================================ //
9
10
#[allow(unused_imports)]
11
use super::*;
12
13
// ================================================================================================================================ //
14
15
#[cfg(target_os = "windows")]
16
/// OS-specific Surface Extension.
17
pub type NativeSurfaceExt = khr::Win32Surface;
18
19
#[cfg(target_os = "linux")]
20
/// OS-specific Surface Extension.
21
pub type NativeSurfaceExt = khr::XcbSurface;
22
23
#[cfg(target_os = "macos")]
24
/// OS-specific Surface Extension.
25
pub type NativeSurfaceExt = ext::MetalSurface;
26
27
// ================================================================================================================================ //
28
29
/// Collection of loaded Instance Extension functions.
30
pub struct InstanceExts {
31
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VK_KHR_surface.html>
32
    pub surface: khr::Surface,
33
34
    /// Windows: <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VK_KHR_win32_surface.html>\
35
    ///   Linux: <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VK_KHR_xcb_surface.html>\
36
    ///   MacOS: <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VK_EXT_metal_surface.html>
37
    pub native_surface: NativeSurfaceExt,
38
39
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VK_EXT_debug_utils.html>
40
    pub debug_utils: ext::DebugUtils,
41
}
42
43
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
44
45
impl InstanceExts {
46
    /// Loads and stores the various Instance Extensions.

/// All Vulkan-related State that exists independent of any renderable resources.
28
pub struct VulkanContext {
29
    /// List of available Physical Devices to use.
30
    pub devices: Vec<PhysicalDevice>,
31
32
    #[cfg(debug_assertions)]
33
    /// Debug-only Callback state.
34
    pub debug: DebugMessenger,
35
36
    /// Instance Extension Function-loaders.
37
    pub exts: Aliased<InstanceExts>,
38
39
    /// The Vulkan Instance.
40
    pub instance: Aliased<Instance>,
41
42
    /// Vulkan Function-loader.
43
    pub entry: Aliased<ash::Entry>,
44
}
45
46

/// Wrapper for a `VkPhysicalDevice` and associated state.\
16
/// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkPhysicalDevice.html>
17
pub struct PhysicalDevice {
18
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkQueueFamilyProperties.html>
19
    pub queues: Vec<vk::QueueFamilyProperties>,
20
21
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkPhysicalDeviceMemoryProperties.html>
22
    pub memory: vk::PhysicalDeviceMemoryProperties,
23
24
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures.html>
25
    pub features: vk::PhysicalDeviceFeatures,
26
27
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkPhysicalDeviceProperties.html>
28
    pub properties: vk::PhysicalDeviceProperties,
29
30
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkLayerProperties.html>
31
    pub layers: Layers,
32
33
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkExtensionProperties.html>
34
    pub extensions: Extensions,
35
36
    /// Inner `VkPhysicalDevice`.
37
    pub handle: vk::PhysicalDevice,
38
}

/*

5
6
//! Internal functionality to Render state provided by the RGE Game Engine to a Window, using Vulkan.
7
8
// ================================================================================================================================ //
9
10
#[allow(unused_imports)]
11
use super::*;
12
13
// ================================================================================================================================ //
14
15
impl VulkanRenderable {
16
    /// Attempts to render the provided RGE State.
17
    ///
18
    /// If either of the Window dimensions (width or height) is 0, this function will return without rendering.\
19
    /// In some cases (such as the Window being resized), rendering may spuriously fail.\
20
    /// In such a case, the Swapchain will be re-created, and it will attempt to render again from the start.
21
    ///
22
    /// # Panics
23
    /// Panics if rendering fails several times in a row.
24
1.77k
    pub fn render(&mut self, settings: &RenderSettings) {
25
1.77k
        let mut fails = 0;
26
27
1.77k

    /// Queries the Size of the Render Surface's Window and updates internal state as needed, returning boolean flags to indicate the changes.\
92
    /// The 0th flag represents whether the Window size is valid (non-zero in both dimensions).
93
    /// The 1st flag represents whether the Window size has changed.
94
1.77k
    fn update_size(&mut self) -> (bool, bool) {
95
1.77k

96
97
1.77k

1.77k

99
1.77k
100
1.77k
        self.surface.size = real_size;

1.77k

1.77k
        (valid, changed)

1.77k
    }

    /// Attempts to render a Frame.\
130
    /// Returns `true` if succeeded, and `false` if the swapchain needs updated.
131
1.41k
    fn render_frame(&self, settings: &RenderSettings) -> bool {
132
1.41k
        let prev_frame = self.frames.list.get(self.prev_frame_idx()).unwrap();
133
1.41k
        let this_frame = self.frames.list.get(self.frame_idx).unwrap();
134
1.41k
135
1.41k
        let image_acquired = this_frame.sync.image.handle;
136
1.41k
        let render_finished = this_frame.sync.render.handle;
137
1.41k
        let this_frame_available = this_frame.sync.frame.handle;
138
1.41k
        let prev_frame_available = prev_frame.sync.frame.handle;
139
140
        // -------------------------------- //
141
142
        // <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/vkQueuePresentKHR.html>
143
144
        // -------------------------------- //
145
146
1.41k
        let Some(image_idx) = self.acquire_image(image_acquired, &[this_frame_available, prev_frame_available], &[this_frame_available])
147
        else {
148
0
            return false;
149
        };
150
1.41k
        assert_eq!(self.frame_idx, image_idx as usize);
151
152
1.41k
        self.record_commands(this_frame, settings);
153
1.41k
154
1.41k
        if !self.submit_commands(
155
1.41k
            this_frame,
156
1.41k
            &[image_acquired],
157
1.41k
            &[render_finished],
158
1.41k
            this_frame_available,
159
1.41k
        ) {
160
0
            return false;
161
1.41k
        }
162
1.41k
163
1.41k
        if !self.present_image(image_idx, &[render_finished]) {
164
0
            return false;
165
1.41k
        }
166
1.41k
167
1.41k
        true
168
1.41k
    }

    /// Attempts to acquires a Frame from the Swapchain.
173
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/vkAcquireNextImageKHR.html>
174
1.41k
    fn acquire_image(
175
1.41k
        &self,
176
1.41k
        signal_semaphore: vk::Semaphore,
177
1.41k
        wait_fences: &[vk::Fence],
178
1.41k
        reset_fences: &[vk::Fence],
179
1.41k
    ) -> Option<u32> {
180
1.41k
        let device = unsafe { self.device() };
181
1.41k
        let ash_device = device.ash_device();
182
1.41k
        let frames = &self.frames;
183
1.41k
        let swapchain = &frames.swapchain;
184
1.41k
        let swapchain_ext = unsafe { swapchain.ext() };
185
1.41k
186
1.41k
        // -------------------------------- //
187
1.41k
188
1.41k
        let res = unsafe { ash_device.wait_for_fences(wait_fences, true, u64::MAX) };
189
1.41k
        res.unwrap();
190
1.41k
191
1.41k
        let res = unsafe {
192
1.41k
            swapchain_ext.acquire_next_image(
193
1.41k
                swapchain.handle,
194
1.41k
                u64::MAX,
195
1.41k
                signal_semaphore,
196
1.41k
                vk::Fence::null(),
197
1.41k
            )
198
        };
199
1.41k
        let (image_idx, _suboptimal) = match res {
200
0
            Err(vk::Result::ERROR_OUT_OF_DATE_KHR) => return None,
201
1.41k
            _res => _res.unwrap(),
202
1.41k
        };
203
1.41k
204
1.41k
        let res = unsafe { ash_device.reset_fences(reset_fences) };
205
1.41k
        res.unwrap();
206
1.41k
207
1.41k
        // -------------------------------- //
208
1.41k
209
1.41k
        Some(image_idx)
210
1.41k
    }

    /// Records the actual commands to render the Frame into a Command Buffer.
215
1.41k
    fn record_commands(&self, frame: &Frame, settings: &RenderSettings) {

1.41k
        let device = unsafe { self.device() };
217
1.41k
        let ash_device = device.ash_device();
218
1.41k

1.41k
        let ds_info = &self.ds_info;

1.41k

1.41k

1.41k

1.41k

1.41k

225
1.41k

1.41k

1.41k
            ash_device

1.41k
                .reset_command_buffer(frame.commands, vk::CommandBufferResetFlags::empty())

1.41k

1.41k

1.41k

1.41k

1.41k

1.41k

1.41k
            extent: ds_info.ideal_resolution(surface),

1.41k

1.41k

1.41k

1.41k

1.41k

1.41k

1.41k

1.41k

1.41k

1.41k

        /// Internal Struct for representing a Sub-Buffer.

        /// Internal Struct for wrapping a Pipeline and its associated Vertex and (Optional) Index Buffers.

1.41k
        // ---------------------------------------------------------------- //

1.41k

1.41k
        let pipelines = {

1.41k
            let bytes_point_list = bytes_ref(&settings.point_list);

1.41k
            let bytes_line_list = bytes_ref(&settings.line_list);

1.41k
            let bytes_tri_list = bytes_ref(&settings.tri_list);

1.41k
            let bytes_line_strip = bytes_ref(&settings.line_strip);

1.41k

1.41k
            let bytes_tri_fan = bytes_ref(&settings.tri_fan);

            let bytes_line_strip_idx = bytes_ref(&settings.line_strip_idx);

1.41k
            let bytes_tri_strip_idx = bytes_ref(&settings.tri_strip_idx);

1.41k
            let bytes_tri_fan_idx = bytes_ref(&settings.tri_fan_idx);
289
1.41k

1.41k
            let bytes_vtx = bytes_point_list.len()

1.41k
                + bytes_line_list.len()
292
1.41k
                + bytes_tri_list.len()
293
1.41k
                + bytes_line_strip.len()
294
1.41k
                + bytes_tri_strip.len()
295
1.41k
                + bytes_tri_fan.len();
296
1.41k
297
1.41k
            let bytes_idx =
298
1.41k
                bytes_line_strip_idx.len() + bytes_tri_strip_idx.len() + bytes_tri_fan_idx.len();
299
1.41k
300
1.41k
            // ---------------------------------------------------------------- //
301
1.41k

12.7k

303
12.7k
                let new_offset = offset + bytes.len();
304
12.7k
                let mem_slice = &mut buffer[offset..new_offset];
305
12.7k
                mem_slice.copy_from_slice(bytes);
306
12.7k
                new_offset
307
12.7k
            };

                new_offset

1.41k

1.41k

1.41k

1.41k

    /// Given a list of a Physical Devices, picks the best one to use to render to the given Window Surface.
82
1
    pub fn new(context: &VulkanContext, surface: &Surface) -> Self {
83
1
        let context_ptr = NonNull::from(context);
84
1
85
1
        let physical_ranks = Self::device_rankings(&context.devices, surface);
86
1
        let physical_best = physical_ranks.max().unwrap();
87
1
        let physical_idx = physical_best.idx;
88
1
        let physical_ref = context.devices.get(physical_idx).unwrap();
89
1
90
1
        let graphics_ranks = Self::graphics_queue_rankings(physical_ref, surface);
91
1
        let graphics_best = graphics_ranks.max().unwrap();
92
1

93
1
        assert!(physical_ref.queues.get(graphics_idx).is_some());
94
95
1

96
1

97

    /// Ranks a Physical Device.\
155
    /// It must support all the required Extensions and Layers.\
156
    /// It must support Graphics and Present operations.
157
    /// Higher-End GPUs are prefered over CPUs.
158
2
    fn rank_device(
159
2
        device: &PhysicalDevice,
160
2
        _surface: &Surface,
161
2
        ds_info: &DeviceSurfaceInfo,
162
2

163
2
        required_layers: &[NtString],
164
2
    ) -> usize {
165
2
        if !device.extensions.supports_all(required_extensions) {
166
0
            return 0;
167
2
        }
168
2
169
2
        if !device.layers.supports_all(required_layers) {

0
            return 0;
171
2

172
2
173
2

174
0
            return 0;
175
2
        }
176
2
177
2
        {
178
2
            let mut rank = 1;
179
2
180
2

181
1
                vk::PhysicalDeviceType::DISCRETE_GPU => rank += 50,
182
1
                vk::PhysicalDeviceType::INTEGRATED_GPU => rank += 40,
183
0
                vk::PhysicalDeviceType::VIRTUAL_GPU => rank += 30,
184

186

/*
2
 *  Crate: RGE
3
 * Module: Vulkan - Renderable - Device-Surface Info

5
6
//! Internal utilities for querying Device/Surface Information.
7
8
// ================================================================================================================================ //
9
10
#[allow(unused_imports)]
11
use super::*;
12
13
// ================================================================================================================================ //
14
15
/// Information about a Device/Surface combination.
16
pub struct DeviceSurfaceInfo {
17
    /// Whether or not each Queue-Family supports the Surface.
18
    pub support: Vec<bool>,
19
20
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkPresentModeKHR.html>
21
    pub modes: Vec<vk::PresentModeKHR>,
22
23
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkSurfaceFormatKHR.html>
24
    pub formats: Vec<vk::SurfaceFormatKHR>,
25
26
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkSurfaceCapabilitiesKHR.html>
27
    pub capabilities: vk::SurfaceCapabilitiesKHR,
28
}

//! Internal utilities for managing Vulkan Framebuffers.
7
8
// ================================================================================================================================ //
9
10
#[allow(unused_imports)]
11
use super::*;
12

// ================================================================================================================================ //
14
15
/// Handles to objects associated with a Frame that can be rendered to and presented to the screen.
16
pub struct Frame {
17
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkCommandBuffer.html>
18
    pub commands: vk::CommandBuffer,
19
20
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkFramebuffer.html>
21
    pub buffer: vk::Framebuffer,
22
23
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkImageView.html>
24
    pub view: vk::ImageView,
25
26
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkImage.html>
27
    pub image: vk::Image,
28
29
    /// Synchronization Primitives for accessing this Frame.
30
    pub sync: Sync,
31
32
    /// Pointer to the object responsible for freeing this resource.
33
    device_ptr: NonNull<Device>,
34
}
35
36

    /// Creates a `VkImageView` associated with this Frame.
86
384
    pub fn create_view(&self, device: &Device, ds_info: &DeviceSurfaceInfo) -> vk::ImageView {

/// A collection of Multiple Frames owned by a Swapchain.
149
pub struct Frames {
150
    /// The list of Frames.
151
    pub list: Vec<Frame>,
152
153
    /// The Swapchain that owns the Frames.
154
    pub swapchain: Swapchain,
155
156
    /// The `VkCommandBuffers` allocated from the `VkCommandPool`.
157
    pub commands: Vec<vk::CommandBuffer>,
158
159
    /// The Command Pool for allocating Command Buffers.
160
    pub pool: CommandPool,
161
}
162

169

170
1

174
1

1

177

/// Wrapper for a `VkDevice`.\
16
/// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkDevice.html>
17
pub struct LogicalDevice {
18
    /// Queue for Presenting Images to a Surface.
19
    pub present_queue: vk::Queue,
20
21
    /// Queue for Submitting Graphics commands.
22
    pub graphics_queue: vk::Queue,
23
24
    /// Inner `ash` `VkDevice`.
25
    pub inner: ash::Device,
26
}
27
28

32
1
    pub fn new(instance: &ash::Instance, selection: &DeviceSelection) -> Self {

1

34
1

35

36

/// A combination of a Vulkan Device/Surface with its associated Shaders & Graphics Pipelines.
43
pub struct VulkanRenderable {
44
    /// Index of the current Frame.
45
    pub frame_idx: usize,
46
47
    /// List of Frames to be rendered.
48
    pub frames: Frames,
49
50
    /// Memory Buffers for CPU-GPU interaction.
51
    pub buffers: Buffers,
52
53
    /// Render Pipelines for the Shaders.
54
    pub pipelines: ShaderPipelines,
55
56
    /// Compiled Shader Programs.
57
    pub shaders: Shaders,
58
59
    /// Information about the Device/Surface combination.
60
    pub ds_info: DeviceSurfaceInfo,
61
62
    /// The Logical Device for using Vulkan.
63
    pub device: Aliased<Device>,
64
65
    /// The Window Surface.
66
    pub surface: Surface,
67
68
    /// Pointer to the object responsible for freeing this resource.
69
    context_ptr: NonNull<VulkanContext>,
70
}
71
72
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
73
74

// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //

89
impl VulkanRenderable {
90
    /// Given a Window, creates a Vulkan Surface, Logical Device, and Render Pipelines, and wraps them together.
91
1
    pub fn new(context: &VulkanContext, window: WindowHandle, vsync: bool) -> Aliased<Self> {
92
1
        let context_ptr = NonNull::from(context);
93
1
94
1
        let surface = Surface::new(context, window);
95
1
96
1
        let device = Device::new(context, &surface);
97
1
        let device_ref = unsafe { device.as_ref() };
98
1
        let physical_ref = unsafe { device_ref.selection.physical() };
99
1
100
1
        let ds_info = DeviceSurfaceInfo::new(physical_ref, &surface);
101
1
102
1
        let shaders = Shaders::compile(device_ref);
103
1
        let pipelines = ShaderPipelines::new(device_ref, &surface, &ds_info, &shaders);
104
1
105
1
        let buffers = Buffers::new(device_ref);
106
1
107
1
        let frames = Frames::collect(
108
1
            device_ref,
109
1
            &surface,
110
1
            &ds_info,
111
1
            &pipelines.render_pass,
112
1
            vsync,
113
1
        );
114
1
        let frame_idx = 0;
115
1

16
/// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkSurfaceKHR.html>
17
pub struct Surface {

26

29
    /// Pointer to the object responsible for creating this resource.

}

/// A collection of Synchronization Objects used by a `Frame` during Rendering.
125
pub struct Sync {
126
    /// Semaphore to wait until an Image can be Acquired.
127
    pub image: Semaphore,
128
129
    /// Semaphore to signal when Rendering has Finished.
130
    pub render: Semaphore,
131
132
    /// Fence to block CPU access while a Frame is In-Use.
133
    pub frame: Fence,
134
}
135
136

137
138

384

384

//! Internal utilities for creating Buffers in Device Memory to be used for Vertex/Index buffers.
7
8
// ================================================================================================================================ //
9
10
#[allow(unused_imports)]
11
use super::*;
12
13
// ================================================================================================================================ //
14
15
/// A group of buffers bound to Device Memory.
16
pub struct Buffers {
17
    /// Index buffer.
18
    pub index: Buffer,
19
20
    /// Vertex buffer.
21
    pub vertex: Buffer,
22
23
    /// Device memory.
24
    pub memory: DeviceMemory,
25
}
26
27
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
28
29
#[allow(unused)]
30
/// Size of a Kibibyte.
31
const KB: vk::DeviceSize = 0x400;
32
33
#[allow(unused)]
34
/// Size of a Mebibyte.
35
const MB: vk::DeviceSize = 0x400 * 0x400;
36
37
#[allow(unused)]
38
/// Size of a Gibibyte.
39
const GB: vk::DeviceSize = 0x400 * 0x400 * 0x400;
40
41
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
42
43
impl Buffers {
44
    /// Creates the Buffers, allocates Device Memory, and binds the Buffers to the Device Memory.
45
    #[allow(clippy::identity_op)]
46
1
    pub fn new(device: &Device) -> Self {
47
1
        let vertex = Buffer::new(
48
1
            device,
49
1
            vk::BufferUsageFlags::VERTEX_BUFFER,
50
1
            vk::SharingMode::EXCLUSIVE,
51
1
            1 * GB,
52
1
        );
53
1
54
1
        let index = Buffer::new(
55
1
            device,
56
1
            vk::BufferUsageFlags::INDEX_BUFFER,
57
1
            vk::SharingMode::EXCLUSIVE,
58
1
            1 * MB,
59
1
        );
60
1
61
1
        let alloc_size = vertex.mem_reqs.size + index.mem_reqs.size;
62
1

63
1
        let alloc_props =
64
1
            vk::MemoryPropertyFlags::HOST_VISIBLE | vk::MemoryPropertyFlags::HOST_COHERENT;
65
1
66

67
1
68
1

69
1
            index,
70
1
            vertex,
71
1

72
1

1

1

/// Wrapper for a `VkBuffer`.\
86
/// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkBuffer.html>
87
pub struct Buffer {
88
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkMemoryRequirements.html>
89
    pub mem_reqs: vk::MemoryRequirements,
90
91
    /// Inner `VkBuffer`.
92
    pub handle: vk::Buffer,
93
94
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkSharingMode.html>
95
    pub sharing_mode: vk::SharingMode,
96
97
    /// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkBufferUsageFlagBits.html>
98
    pub usage: vk::BufferUsageFlags,
99
100
    /// Byte-Size of this Buffer.
101
    pub size: vk::DeviceSize,
102
103
    /// Byte-Offset of this Buffer.
104
    pub offs: vk::DeviceSize,
105
106
    /// Pointer to the object responsible for freeing this resource.
107
    device_ptr: NonNull<Device>,
108
}

impl CommandPool {
68
    /// Allocates `count` Command Buffers from this pool.
69
1
    pub fn allocate_buffers(&self, count: usize) -> Vec<vk::CommandBuffer> {
70
1
        let alloc_info = vk::CommandBufferAllocateInfo {
71
1
            level: vk::CommandBufferLevel::PRIMARY,
72
1
            command_pool: self.handle,
73
1
            command_buffer_count: count as u32,
74
1
            ..Default::default()
75
1
        };
76
1
77
1
        let res = unsafe { self.ash_device().allocate_command_buffers(&alloc_info) };

6
//! Rust-wrappers around GLSL Data Types.
7
//!
8
//! <https://www.khronos.org/opengl/wiki/Data_Type_(GLSL)>
9
10
// ================================================================================================================================ //
11
12
#![allow(non_camel_case_types)]
13
#![allow(unused)]
14
15
// ================================================================================================================================ //
16
17
#[allow(unused_imports)]
18
use super::*;
19
20
use core::ops::{Deref, DerefMut};
21
22
pub use core::f32::consts as float_consts;
23
pub use core::f64::consts as double_consts;
24
25
// ================================================================================================================================ //
26
27
/// Internal Trait for associating Rust Types with Vulkan Image Formats.
28
pub(crate) trait VulkanFormat {
29
    /// <https://www.khronos.org/registry/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkFormat.html>
30
    const VK_FORMAT: vk::Format;
31
}
32
33
// ================================================================================================================================ //
34
35
// Scalars
36
37
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
38
39
/// <https://www.khronos.org/opengl/wiki/Data_Type_(GLSL)#Scalars>
40
pub type int = i32;
41
42
impl VulkanFormat for int {
43
    const VK_FORMAT: vk::Format = vk::Format::R32_SINT;
44
}
45
46
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
47
48
/// <https://www.khronos.org/opengl/wiki/Data_Type_(GLSL)#Scalars>
49
pub type uint = u32;
50
51
impl VulkanFormat for uint {
52
    const VK_FORMAT: vk::Format = vk::Format::R32_UINT;
53
}
54
55
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
56
57
/// <https://www.khronos.org/opengl/wiki/Data_Type_(GLSL)#Scalars>
58
pub type float = f32;
59
60
impl VulkanFormat for float {
61
    const VK_FORMAT: vk::Format = vk::Format::R32_SFLOAT;
62
}

pub struct Vertex {
240
    /// Position of the Vertex. Only XY values are used for positioning. Z values represent Depth/Layer [TODO]. W values represent Point-Size.

249
/// Creates a `vec2` using 0-2 arguments. Unspecified values default to `0.0`.
250
#[macro_export]
251
macro_rules! vec2 {
252
    () => {
253
        $crate::glsl::vec2(0.0, 0.0)
254
    };
255
    ($x:expr) => {
256
        $crate::glsl::vec2($x, 0.0)
257
    };
258
    ($x:expr, $y:expr) => {
259
        $crate::glsl::vec2($x, $y)
260
    };
261
}
262
263
/// Creates a `vec3` using 0-3 arguments. Unspecified values default to `0.0`.
264
#[macro_export]
265
macro_rules! vec3 {
266
    () => {
267
        $crate::glsl::vec3(0.0, 0.0, 0.0)
268
    };
269
    ($x:expr) => {
270
        $crate::glsl::vec3($x, 0.0, 0.0)
271
    };
272
    ($x:expr, $y:expr) => {
273
        $crate::glsl::vec3($x, $y, 0.0)
274
    };
275
    ($x:expr, $y:expr, $z:expr) => {
276
        $crate::glsl::vec3($x, $y, $z)
277
    };
278
}
279
280
/// Creates a `vec4` using 0-4 arguments. Unspecified values default to `0.0`.
281
#[macro_export]
282
macro_rules! vec4 {
283
    () => {
284
        $crate::glsl::vec4(0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0)
285
    };
286
    ($x:expr) => {
287
        $crate::glsl::vec4($x, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0)
288
    };
289
    ($x:expr, $y:expr) => {
290
        $crate::glsl::vec4($x, $y, 0.0, 0.0)
291
    };
292
    ($x:expr, $y:expr, $z:expr) => {
293
        $crate::glsl::vec4($x, $y, $z, 0.0)
294
    };
295
    ($x:expr, $y:expr, $z:expr, $w:expr) => {
296
        $crate::glsl::vec4($x, $y, $z, $w)
297
    };

}
299
300
/// Creates a `vec4` using 0, 1, 2, 3, or 4 arguments.
301
/// 0 Arguments: Unspecified RGB values default to `0.0`. Alpha value defaults to `0.0`.
302
/// 1 Argument : First Argument is used for all RGB values. Alpha value defaults to `1.0`.
303
/// 2 Arguments: First Argument is used for all RGB values. Second Argument is used for Alpha value.
304
/// 3 Arguments: Specified RGB values are used. Alpha value defaults to `1.0`.
305
/// 4 Arguments: Specified RGB and Alpha values are used.
306
#[macro_export]
307
macro_rules! rgba {
308
    () => {
309
        $crate::glsl::vec4(0.0, 0.0, 0.0, 0.0)
310
    };
311
    ($v:expr) => {
312
        $crate::glsl::vec4($v, $v, $v, 1.0)
313
    };
314
    ($v:expr, $a:expr) => {
315
        $crate::glsl::vec4($v, $v, $v, $a)
316
    };
317
    ($r:expr, $g:expr, $b:expr) => {
318
        $crate::glsl::vec4($r, $g, $b, 1.0)
319
    };
320
    ($r:expr, $g:expr, $b:expr, $a:expr) => {
321
        $crate::glsl::vec4($r, $g, $b, $a)
322
    };
323
}

16
/// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkPipeline.html>
17

19
    pub handles: Vec<vk::Pipeline>,
20
21
    /// Pointer to the object responsible for freeing this resource.

23
}

/// Wrapper for a `VkDeviceMemory`.
16
/// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkDeviceMemory.html>
17
pub struct DeviceMemory {
18

19
    pub handle: vk::DeviceMemory,
20
21
    /// Size of the allocated memory, in bytes.
22
    pub capacity: vk::DeviceSize,
23
24
    /// Pointer to the object responsible for freeing this resource.
25
    device_ptr: NonNull<Device>,
26
}

1

/// Device Memory that was mapped to a CPU-visible region.
98
pub struct MappedMemory<'a> {
99
    /// Number of mapped bytes.
100
    size: vk::DeviceSize,
101
102
    /// Pointer to mapped bytes.
103
    buffer: *mut c_void,
104
105
    /// Memory this was mapped from.
106
    memory: &'a DeviceMemory,
107
108
    /// Device that holds the memory.
109
    device: &'a Device,
110
}
111
112

//! Internal utilities for defining Vulkan Pipeline Layouts.
7
8
// ================================================================================================================================ //
9
10
#[allow(unused_imports)]
11
use super::*;

// ================================================================================================================================ //
14
15
/// Wrapper for a `VkPipelineLayout`.\
16
/// <https://registry.khronos.org/vulkan/specs/1.3-extensions/man/html/VkPipelineLayout.html>
17
pub struct PipelineLayout {
18
    /// Push Constants used in the Shaders.
19
    pub pc_range: vk::PushConstantRange,
20
21
    /// Inner `VkPipelineLayout`.
22
    pub handle: vk::PipelineLayout,
23
24
    /// Pointer to the object responsible for freeing this resource.
25
    device_ptr: NonNull<Device>,
26
}
27
28
// -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- //
29
30
/// Getter functions for variables behind `Aliased` pointers.
31
#[allow(clippy::missing_docs_in_private_items)]
32
#[allow(unused)]
33
impl PipelineLayout {
34
1
    pub unsafe fn device(&self) -> &Device {
35
1
        self.device_ptr.as_ref()
36
1
    }
<rge::vulkan::shaders::pipeline_layout::PipelineLayout>::device
Line
Count
Source
34

35
1
        self.device_ptr.as_ref()
36
1
    }
Unexecuted instantiation: <rge::vulkan::shaders::pipeline_layout::PipelineLayout>::device
37

1
    pub unsafe fn ash_device(&self) -> &ash::Device {
39
1
        &self.device().logical.inner
40
1
    }

//! The all-encompassing module where an entire Render Pipeline is created for the Shaders, from start to finish.
7
8
// ================================================================================================================================ //
9
10
#[allow(unused_imports)]
11
use super::*;
12
13
use glsl::VulkanFormat;
14
15
// ================================================================================================================================ //
16
17
/// All state required for Shader Pipelines.
18
pub struct ShaderPipelines {
19
    /// Graphics Pipelines for each type of primitive.
20
    pub graphics: GraphicsPipelines,
21
22
    /// Layout of all the Graphics Pipelines.
23
    pub layout: PipelineLayout,
24
25
    /// Render Pass for all the Graphics Pipelines.
26
    pub render_pass: RenderPass,
27
}
28
29

//! Utility for creating `Box`ed values that aren't subject to Undefined-Behavior from Pointer-Aliasing.
7
8
// ================================================================================================================================ //
9
10
use core::ops::{Deref, DerefMut};
11
use core::ptr::NonNull;
12
13
// ================================================================================================================================ //
14
15
/// A wrapper for `NonNull` that behaves like `Box` but without the `noalias` constraints.
16
#[repr(transparent)]
17
pub struct Aliased<T>(NonNull<T>);
18
19

45
12.7k
